Galen.Action: Carries the candelabra up to the turret and alerts Magister Ulrich that something is wrong.
Shows concern and asks Ulrich what has happened when Ulrich appears troubled.
Admits to not having dared to try the Ritual of Banishment and questions its point.
Expresses hatred for books and drills, desires a real task.
Instinctively holds onto the amulet Ulrich gives him, showing trust.
Eagerly moves to investigate the voices he hears, showing curiosity and engagement.
Claims to have almost mastered a difficult magical transmutation but admits to only memorizing two chapters of an important book and not attempting a crucial ritual.
Expresses frustration with theoretical learning and desires a real task, showing impatience and disregard for necessary foundations.
Eagerly reacts to the amulet and the voices it reveals, showing alertness and readiness to act on new information.
Helps Ulrich prepare for the audience and proactively provides the sorcerer with his sticks.
Expresses uncertainty about what he sees and admits he doesn't see anything, showing lack of awareness in that moment.
Regards his master sullenly without answering him when spoken to.
Mocks Ulrich sarcastically about his injury instead of offering support.
Calls out to the Urlanders to suggest drawing straws to carry the injured Ulrich, showing concern for fairness and practical help.
Volunteers himself to go on the dangerous mission, expressing eagerness to prove himself and offering to take on risk.
Heeds Ulrich's warning to say nothing despite sensing trouble.
Insists on going despite being told he is not ready, showing eagerness but possibly overconfidence.
Heeds Ulrich's whispered warning to say nothing, demonstrating restraint and listening to experienced guidance.
Moves forward sensing trouble but is stopped, indicating awareness but lack of authority or control in the situation.
Hesitates before throwing the dagger despite pressure and alarm, showing respect and caution.
Obeys a difficult order to fetch a dangerous dagger from the conjuring room quickly, showing responsiveness and courage despite alarm.
Examines the dagger carefully to assess if it is a trick weapon, showing analytical thinking.
Hesitates momentarily before throwing the dagger as instructed, indicating some uncertainty but ultimately complying.
Hesitates to act but tries to escape locked room when trapped, showing fear and self-preservation.
Presses face to crack in shutter to witness Ulrich's death, showing concern and emotional engagement.
Turns away from window and gazes blankly into gloom after Ulrich's death, possibly indicating shock or emotional withdrawal.
Hesitates before tossing the object but does so competently enough for the old conjurer to catch it easily.
Rushes to escape the room when locked in but each exit shuts before he can leave, showing desperation without apparent preparedness or contingency.
Stops hammering and watches intently from behind the shutter crack, demonstrating awareness and focus on the unfolding dramatic scene.
Unable to prevent the capture or death of Ulrich, and trapped without recourse, reflecting a lack of effective action under pressure.
Releases the crow, the falcon, and the great horned owl from their cages.
Sows salt over the pentagram on the floor, covers alchemical devices, and secures books and parchments.
Approaches Hodge and asks what he is doing, showing concern.
Touches burning brand to kindling and calmly stands his ground despite the strange green flames and intense heat.
Considers the significance of the amulet carefully and shows resolve to act after observing others.
Systematically secures books, parchments, magical devices, and releases animals before departure, demonstrating thoroughness and foresight.
Questions Hodge about his actions in a composed manner, indicating awareness but no impulsive confrontation.
Uses magic to animate the vines covering the castle, shows excitement and focus on his achievement.
Responds to Hodge's warning with a brief command to stand back, ignoring Hodge's concern.
Practices magic while walking with Hodge, appears distracted but engaged, not dismissive of companion.
Comforts Hodge by agreeing he will miss the master too.
Playfully teases Hodge with magical tricks, draping a greatcoat over him and making clothes disappear, but restores them showing respect.
Transforms a leaf into daffodils with a gesture, demonstrates magical skill effortlessly.
Lightheartedly teases Hodge by making his pack float, draping a coat on him, then disappearing his clothes, but stops before causing offense and restores him.
Claims confidently to be the new master despite Hodge's doubts.
Greets peacefully, assures 'we mean no harm', seeks to speak calmly.
Announces himself confidently as successor to the dead sorcerer, taking up responsibility.
Brushes himself off after being caught as an interloper without hostility.
Jumps back to avoid the knife, allowing others to intervene.
Passively accepts being protected and given food by Valerian without complaint.
Does not escalate confrontation or engage aggressively with Greil despite provocation.
Jumps back to avoid Greil's lash, allowing Valerian to intervene and take control of the situation
Relies on others (Valerian) to protect and handle the conflict situation
Nods silently when given food and questions what is wrong with Greil, showing awareness and engagement
Engages Hodge with teasing remarks but ultimately shows concern by returning to look for Valerian after noticing he has dropped out of line.
Dismisses Hodge's hostility with calm retorts and suggests Hodge could leave if unwilling to cooperate.
Questions Hodge about the pouch and calls out his brashness with calm jokes, showing confidence and social awareness.
Engages in a composed verbal exchange with Hodge, maintaining composure despite insults.
Walks back along the trail to find Valerian after noticing he is missing, demonstrating attentiveness and responsibility.
Encourages Valerian not to get separated, insists she come out of the water for safety.
Swims out to Valerian despite her objections, showing concern and companionship.
Does not reveal Valerianâ€™s secret about her gender after discovering it underwater.
Uses a feeble bluff to calm Valerian after the discovery, showing gentle concern.
Leads Valerian not to get separated from the group, showing awareness of safety.
Decides to swim into the pool despite Valerian's objections, showing confidence and initiative.
Presses forward underwater to investigate Valerian, despite unclear risks, demonstrating curiosity and determination.
Reacts with surprise upon discovering Valerian is not a boy, showing natural human response but no loss of composure.
Promises not to tell others about Valerian's secret despite social pressures, indicating thoughtful discretion and emotional intelligence.
Makes a feeble bluff to calm Valerian, which sounds insincere.
Reassures Valerian that no one will find out her secret.
Horrified reaction to vision suggesting danger to Tyrian, shows concern.
Chases after Valerian and calls out to Hodge urgently to help.
Feigns confidence with a feeble bluff when confronted by Valerian calling someone careless.
Observes a mysterious vision at the pool, recognizes its significance, and acts on it immediately by following it.
Sprints urgently through the forest to catch up with Valerian and later to seek help after seeing Hodge injured.
Kneels beside wounded Hodge and listens to him, showing concern.
Frantically tries to save Hodge by using a magic amulet and shakes his body, refusing to accept death.
Addresses Hodge with reassurance, saying 'You're not going to die.'
Feels the pain from the amulet burning his flesh, indicating personal sacrifice in attempting to help Hodge.
Broods silently in the boat, showing emotional struggle but no interaction with others.
Fingers the iron manacles thoughtfully at the lair, considering the danger ahead despite others' worries.
Ignores Valerian's warning and insists on approaching the lair alone.
Seeks other entrances to avoid danger but accepts risk.
Inspects the surroundings carefully and decides to investigate the lair despite warnings.
Ignores Valerian's urgent call to stop and climbs the slope alone towards the lair.
Asks whether there are other entrances, showing strategic thinking.
Proceeds coolly and confidently despite others' concern, indicating self-assurance and composure.
Ignores warnings from Greil and Valerian and probes further into the dragon lair despite danger.
After emerging from the lair, uses the amulet to cause a landslide to destroy the dragon's hiding place, protecting others from harm.
Climbs out of shelter to assess the aftermath of his destructive act on the dragon's lair, showing situational awareness and readiness to evaluate results.
Grins triumphantly but fails to inspire confidence or trust in the Urlanders, indicating a possible overestimation of his impact or social skills.
Arrives at the hall tattered, bedraggled and triumphant, implying successful return from a difficult task.
Dismisses prayer and confession as superstition and boasts about his own achievements.
Boldly demonstrates magical power to silence the monk and assert his claim.
Proclaims victory over the dragon to the people, emphasizing his own role.
Entertains wide-eyed kids and some adults with playful tricks like pulling eggs from ears and coin tricks.
Takes shy Valerian by the hand and politely leads her to the dance.
Lightly teases Valerian about sorcery and encourages her to talk during the dance.
Raises his mug and joins in the villagers' drinking song.
Questions the King's gratitude with suspicion, implying distrust of possible harm.
Smiles at Valerian, reassuring her he will return.
Refuses payment for his magical services, stating that magical practice is its own reward and seeks only a greater challenge.
Responds defiantly to the King's hostile questioning about his role and the consequences of failure, showing little deference or warmth toward the King.
Refuses payment, claiming magical practice is its own reward and seeks greater challenge.
Claims the dragon is dead confidently despite the King's doubts.
Does not demonstrate immediate action or resistance after being imprisoned; merely sits and stares.
Inscribes a pentagram and attempts a magical ritual to escape confinement.
Responds politely and calmly to Elspeth's unexpected visit and gift of food and blankets despite being a prisoner.
Does not show immediate suspicion or hostility towards Elspeth, a princess from the opposing side, but listens quietly.
Inscribes a pentagram and runic signs, attempts a spell to open his cell window.
Becomes frustrated and resorts to rattling the bars after the spell fails to work immediately.
Responds politely and attentively to Elspeth, showing openness and calm despite captivity.
Questions Elspeth skeptically about her participation in the sacrifices, doubts her truthfulness initially but then apologizes for his suspicion.
Makes a sarcastic or dismissive remark calling Elspeth 'Virgin' when she said 'Maiden'.
Questions Elspeth about the lists and rumors, shows skepticism rather than blind trust.
Does not follow up or press Elspeth when she leaves abruptly, showing a lack of assertiveness.
Engages in conversation and reveals concern about who must die, reflecting thoughtful consideration.
Rolls off his straw palette and gets to his feet after feeling the tremor, showing alertness and readiness.
Escapes from his cell after the earthquake, showing quick thinking and self-preservation.
Rides a horse recklessly through the courtyard and then into the building, causing chaos and damage.
Avoids direct confrontation by retreating and running from Tyrian.
Fights through enemies to reach the King and his daughter, showing determination to protect.
Escapes danger quickly through a broken wall without apparent concern for others.
Navigates a narrow hallway on horseback while pursued by enemies, demonstrating control and quick thinking.
Successfully escapes a trap by provoking and timing a structural collapse to create an exit and flee.
Engages in a daring staircase escape while facing multiple soldiers, showing courage but also risk-taking.
Reins in to observe the destruction of the village caused by the dragon, showing situational awareness and composure under distress.
Attempts to join a bucket brigade to help with the fire.
Does not respond violently or aggressively when rejected and attacked by villagers.
Seeks help from Greil in a moment of desperation.
Attempts to join the bucket brigade to help with the fire.
Is rejected and physically assaulted by villagers blaming him for the disaster.
Quickly runs down an alley to escape the angry mob.
Bumps into a glassy-eyed man and fails to gain his help.
Takes shelter in Valerian's house and secures the door behind him.
Admits he can't help and feels like a fraud, apologizes sincerely.
Refuses to help put out the fire or help the injured despite the urgent need.
Admits he cannot perform magic or help during the crisis, stating he is an imposter and powerless.
Barges into the room decisively and attempts to engage, showing initial confidence in facing the situation.
Unfolds himself from cramped trap door with determination, engages seriously with Simon and Valerian about weapons.
Unfolds from cramped trap door with determination, carefully examines weapons, tests and rejects several swords before seeking the sharpest one.
Expresses doubt about the sharpness of available weapons and insists on needing a sharper sword for his purpose.
Tests edge of exquisite sword despite warning, showing eagerness and some lack of caution.
Walks into the stream and pushes the sword-tip into the sandy bottom to demonstrate something important.
Shows doubt and hesitation with a face full of doubt regarding the dangerous task ahead.
Asks for the amulet, indicating caution and respect for safety.
Carefully tests the sword in the stream, positioning it to split the current and observing its effect on floating leaves.
Shows doubt visibly during discussion about the nature of what they are to face.
Demonstrates awareness of need for the amulet to proceed, indicating understanding of necessary tools.
Attends the pagan ritual disguised in rough clothes among common folk, blending in rather than standing out.
Keeps his identity hidden and pulls his hat low over his eyes when the King proclaims a bounty on him, displaying caution and avoidance rather than confrontational or boastful behavior.
Responds calmly and simply to Valerian about knowing the Princess, showing no arrogance or disdain.
Notices an unguarded door near the stable and seizes the opportunity.
Sneaks inside the castle without alerting others, rummages through chests and cabinets searching for the amulet.
Carefully avoids detection by the guard, showing caution rather than aggression.
Leaves the library in disarray searching for the amulet, focused on goal with no regard for causing damage.
When confronted and unarmed, requests a weapon and does not initiate violence.
Notices an unguarded door and slips inside, showing awareness and seizing an opportunity.
Rummages through chest and cabinet, breaking a lock to search for the amulet.
Silently slips past a guard by closely following at an arm's length and avoiding detection.
Quickly studies magical writings and symbols in the library, demonstrating insight and comprehension.
Makes the library a mess searching for the amulet, knocking half the books from shelves and opening all chests and trunks but finds nothing.
Is caught by the King and confronts Tyrian unarmed requesting a weapon, showing some confidence but lack of preparedness.
Takes the amulet from the King to save the King's daughter, who pleads with him sincerely.
Lurks in the shadows of the blacksmith's shop watching the village and Greil's sermon.
Accepts the amulet from the King, entrusted with a vital mission to save the King's daughter.
Lurks in the shadows of Simon's metal shop observing the square quietly.
Quietly shuts and bars the door to prevent disturbance during the forging.
Uncovers the sword and performs an invocation to empower it, showing dedication and seriousness.
His presence and action inspire resolve in Valerian, though she looks sad as she leaves.
Quietly shuts and bars the door to secure the environment before proceeding.
Recognizes the type of fire needed and corrects Simon's assumption, showing expertise.
Performs an incantation to activate the sword, which heats and glows as expected, demonstrating skill and knowledge.
Works effectively with Simon in the reforging process, coordinating efforts successfully.
Clasps hands with Simon and expresses satisfaction with their joint effort.
Responds politely and appreciatively to Simon's praise and thanks him.
Shows understanding when Simon apologizes for Valerian's absence without complaint.
Kneels down to splash water on his face quietly and reflects on an image of Valerian, showing private warmth and affection.
Tests the reforged sword's effectiveness with methodical patience and observes results carefully, showing understanding of the weapon's power.
Expresses satisfaction and gratitude appropriately after successful task completion.
Prepares for battle systematically by putting on armor and evaluating his equipment.
Does not show hesitation or doubt when receiving the shield, though the uncertainty about its protection is noted, indicating practical acceptance rather than panic.
Thanks Valerian sincerely for the shield.
Admits he is in love when asked.
Holds and kisses Valerian tenderly while she is trembling.
Thanked Valerian for making the shield and examined it carefully.
Displayed awareness of additional dangers (hatchlings) and prepared mentally to kill them.
Maintained composure and confidence despite warnings of likely death.
Engaged emotionally by confessing love and acting on tender feelings in the face of imminent danger.
Materializes suddenly and uses a menacing gesture to command Horsrik and his men to leave the princess unbound.
Materializes suddenly in a burst of flames to interrupt a public proclamation, demonstrating magical skill and boldness.
Uses a menacing gesture to command Horsrik and soldiers to leave, successfully dispersing them without violence.
Shrieks and jumps away when attacked; stabs repeatedly at the creature biting his leg until it lets go.
After the baby dragons are found dead, Galen attacks the adult dragon without hesitation to avenge or protect, showing urgency and courage.
Leaps out suddenly to attack, risking his life to fight the dragon.
Despite being injured and overwhelmed by the dragon's attack, continues to defend and fight.
Fondly regards Valerian despite his pain and despair.
Contemplates Ulrich's remains silently, avoids explaining it initially.
Does not react initially to Valerian's question about love, seeming distant and unresponsive.
Expresses sympathy for poor Hodge.
Does not respond when Valerian reaches out to take his hand, then abruptly leaves her side.
Tucks the pouch away, throws some clothes on top and ties the satchel shut.
Hurt by small creature but acknowledges killing it and reflects on survival.
Stops suddenly on the path, has a sudden inspiration, flings off his sack, and tears through his gear frantically searching for something.
Ignores Valerian's pleas and rushes alone toward danger, focused on confronting 'him'.
Shows urgency and concern by trying to expose a deception that endangered others.
Grabs Valerian's hand and tells her to stay close while navigating the dangerous underground lair.
Initially resists Valerian entering the lair but ultimately follows her to protect her.
Darts off after telling Valerian to wait, showing some separation which may suggest guarded behavior.
Attempts to assert control by telling Valerian not to come in, showing confidence in his role.
Quickly grabs a torch and leads Valerian through the dark lair, holds torch high to light the way, and grabs her hand advising her to stay close.
Tells Valerian to wait while he darts off to investigate further, demonstrating decisiveness and caution.
Reaches the lake of fire, courageously hops across stepping stones, recites incantation, scatters ashes, anticipating a response.
Despite performing the ritual, no dragon or wizard appears and he is left crouching to keep balance amid quakes.
Shouts to Ulrich to let him know he can see him, expresses relief and gratitude at his master's return.
Crouches to keep his balance during an earthquake, remains present and attentive.
Stares bleakly into the flames without immediate action, showing some passivity.
Recognizes Ulrich reforming in the flames and calls out to him, showing awareness and recognition of important events.
Throws himself at his master's feet in a display of emotion rather than strategic action.
Interrupts Ulrich to honestly admit he is not a sorcerer and lacks power, shows self-awareness and sincerity.
Clearly communicates a painful personal realization to Ulrich despite urgency, demonstrating self-awareness and emotional honesty.
Relies on Ulrich to physically support him and follows his lead instead of taking charge in a critical moment.
Runs to Valerian and embraces her upon her emergence from hiding.
Reluctant to part with Ulrich's amulet but ultimately gives it to him when urged.
Clings to Valerian in terror during the vortex experience.
Refuses to destroy the amulet and Ulrich despite Ulrich's request.
Locates the amulet under his shirt promptly when asked.
Reluctant to part with the amulet despite the urgency, showing hesitation.
Clings to Valerian in terror during the vortex transition.
Expresses willingness to do anything when urged by Ulrich, showing readiness and confidence.
Refuses to destroy the amulet and send Ulrich back, showing emotional resistance and possible lack of judgment.
Takes back the amulet reluctantly, showing hesitation.
Refuses to smash the granite chunk if it means killing Ulrich.
Takes back the amulet reluctantly but does so when prompted, showing cautious acceptance of responsibility.
Glances at the amulet with awe, indicating admiration or perhaps uncertainty but not passivity.
Hesitates or refuses to smash the granite chunk if it means killing Ulrich, showing moral consideration but possibly indecision in a critical moment.
Refuses to kill Ulrich despite the danger, showing restraint and care.
Horrified to see the dragon carry Ulrich away in pain, showing empathy.
Seizes the granite block to destroy the amulet, ultimately defeating the dragon to protect others.
Attempts to grab the stone from Valerian, possibly indicating urgency or desperation but not clearly warmth.
Seizes the granite block decisively and uses it to shatter the amulet, triggering the dragon's defeat.
Initially hesitates and protests when Valerian tries to use the stone, showing reluctance or uncertainty.
Accepts staff from Valerian without complaint despite limping.
Silent when Valerian expresses love and reassurance.
Offers help to Valerian to mount the horse.
Refuses to rest despite limping; shows determination and resilience to continue.
Responds with simple, clear answers demonstrating emotional clarity and focus.
Claims the horse must be wild or wandering loose rather than acknowledging its timely arrival, showing rational thinking.
Falls a step behind and mutters something briefly closing his eyes, potentially indicating momentary weakness or doubt.
Reaches out to help her up
Gently questions if she wants the horse gone, showing consideration
Uses a dragon scale shield to deflect flames, protecting himself from lethal fire.
Springs to his feet and escapes when the dragon pauses, showing awareness and quick reaction.
Leaps out to ambush the dragon and successfully stabs deep between its scales, demonstrating tactical aggression and skill.
Falls and ends up holding half a sword after the dragon's violent movement, indicating some lack of preparedness or physical vulnerability.
Drops to the floor under his shield when rocks and flames rain down, showing prudent defensive behavior.
Reaches out to help Valerian up, demonstrating awareness of others and readiness to assist.
Touches the horse's flanks with his heels and rides off, showing skill and confidence in horseback riding.
Questions whether Valerian wants the horse wished gone, indicating thoughtfulness and caution.
